medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began several weeks before presentation with hoarseness, sore throat, and increasing fatigue. The patient also reported facial puffiness and periorbital swelling. Symptoms worsened over time, with persistence of hoarseness and facial swelling noted about 7 days after presentation and increased fatigue, dyspnea, cough, and weight gain reported 11 days after presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, chronic kidney disease, hypothyroidism, gastroesophageal reflux disease, esophageal motility disorder, abdominal aortic aneurysm, chronic back pain, depression, recurrent urinary tract infections, pneumonia, angioplasty of the right renal artery, cholecystectomy, lobectomy of the right middle lobe, photoselective vaporization of the prostate.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of liver cancer, son has sarcoidosis, two other children are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, lives alone, stopped smoking many years earlier, does not drink alcohol, manages his own medications, children live nearby and are in frequent contact.
